content: branta hat by kimi anderson branta hat by kimi anderson i love a quick beanie especially in worsted weight this project creates a warm squishy winterful beanie that will keep you warm through the chillier months the color combinations are endless and can be tailored to your taste and style if i am really concentrating i can finish this pattern in less than a day perfect for gift knitting some tips for working the colorwork section i do think this is a good pattern for first timers for these 8 row- take your time make sure that the stitches you are stranding behind are spread out over the needle not bunched up all together so that you don t pull too tight and create a scrunched fabric if you wish to make the hat larger or smaller you can add or subtract 6 sts from the overall stitch count and follow the pattern as normal materials yarn -us 6 and us 7 16 circular needles us 7 double-pointed needles -marigold fibers merino worsted heavy worsted weight 100% or size needed to obtain gauge merino wool 195 yards/100 grams 1 skein each shown in ash -stitch marker mc sprig cc1 and buttercream cc2 -tapestry needle approximate yardage mc 72-78 yds cc1 12-14 yds cc2 76-82 skills required yds 3 pompom 24 yds -stranded knitting gauge -knitting in the round -approximately 4 5 stitches per inch with larger needles in -decreasing stitches stockinette skill level finished measurements 20 5 s/m 21 5 l -intermediate brim using your main color and the smaller sized circular needles co 90 96 stitches using the long tail cast on or another stretchy cast on place marker at beginning of round and begin 1x1 ribbing as follows round 1 using mc k1 p1 repeat to end of round repeat r1 16 more times for a total of 17 row of 1x1 ribbing or as many row as it takes to reach 3 inches body change to larger circular needles rounds 1-10 using mc k all sts chevron stripe begin color work pattern attaching cc1 for rounds 1-8 below you can follow the written instructions or use the chevron chart on page 2 round 1 k5 mc k1 cc1 repeat to end of round round 2 k1 cc1 k3 mc k3 cc1 k3 mc repeat to last 2 sts k2 cc1 round 3 k2 cc1 k1 mc k5 cc1 k1 mc repeat to last 3 sts k3 cc1 cut mc leaving a 6 tail to weave in later round 4 using cc1 knit all sts round 5 using cc1 knit all sts round 6 attach cc2 k5 cc1 k1 cc2 repeat to end of round round 7 k1 cc2 k3 cc1 k3 cc2 k3 cc1 to last 2 sts k2 cc2 round 8 k2 cc2 k1 cc1 k5 cc2 k1 cc1 repeat to last 3 sts k3 cc2 cut cc1 leaving a 6 tail to weave in later the remainder of the hat is worked with cc2 knit
